constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA Name: Riverside South Conservation Area
SMKCON Name: Borough Wide Smoke Control Order
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
LBCASE LB Address: PORTSMOUTH ROADKINGSTONLB Grade: GD2LB Ref: 8A/5

decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

Before the start of works a site meeting shall be held between the Local Planning Authority and the persons responsible for undertaking the works to ensure that the conditions attached to the Listed Building Consent are understood and can be complied with in full. Notification of the date and time of a meeting shall be made in writing to the Local Planning Authority. The minutes of the meeting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the start of works. Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

During the works, if hidden historic features are revealed they shall be retained in-situ. Works shall be halted in the relevant area of the building and the Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately. Failure to do so may result in unauthorised works being carried out and an offense being committed.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

Before the start of the relevant part of the works, proposals for any structural works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall be carried out accordingly. The required detail is the submission of a detailed report and method statement by a suitably qualified and experienced chartered structural engineer, addressing the following areas:- Detailing the engineer's qualifications, relevant experience and supervisory role;- Explaining how the existing structure stands;- Detailing the method by which the existing structure is to be supported and protected during the works so as to ensure the structural stability and integrity of all the elements which are to be retained (the temporary works);- Confirming how damage to the building or surrounding buildings and structures will be avoided and how the safety and stability of the historic building fabric will be ensured;- Detailing the structural interventions to ensure that the building will stand in the future, including details (for example and not limited to) of any new foundation design, underpinning, steelwork and other strengthening and their locations and methods of fixing and installation, with sketches as necessary (the permanent works).All excavation and structural works shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and not otherwise. All excavation and structural works shall be carried out by hand. No other excavation or structural works are authorised by this consent without prior approval of the details.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

Before work begins, the position, type and method of installation of all new and relocated services and related fixtures (for the avoidance of doubt this includes communications and information technology servicing) including details of all electrical, drainage and plumbing and heating services for each floor plan and an appraisal how the proposal will impact on any historic fabric (including detail of any new notching of beams and perforations to walls, floors and ceilings), shall be specified and agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority wherever these installations are to be visible, or where ducts or other methods of concealment are proposed. The works shall be implemented only in accordance with such approval.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

All existing historic features including, but not limited to, fireplaces, chimney pieces, plasterwork, architraves, panelling, doors, staircase balustrading shall remain undisturbed in their existing position and shall be fully protected during the course of works on site, unless specifically authorised otherwise on the drawings hereby approved. The development and works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

All new partitions shall be carefully scribed around the existing ornamental mouldings.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

No permission is granted for any recessed lighting (spot lights) to any lathe and plaster ceilings or to any floors other than basement or attic level. Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

A detailed method statement with full particulars of the method for the repair and reinstatement of historic skirtings and other internal joinery shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works. The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

No permission is granted for the removal of any original joinery. All reinstatement of original joinery (including skirting, architraves and window shutters) shall accurately replicate the original, in terms of material, profile and detailing.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

No permission is granted for the removal of any historic doors. All new doors shall accurately replicate, in terms of material, profile and detailing, historic doors surviving to the property. All doors shall have traditional door furniture.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

No permission is granted for the removal of any lathe and plaster ceilings unless demonstrated to be beyond repair. Any new ceilings shall be lathe and plaster to principal floors reusing existing lathes where possible.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

No permission is granted for the removal of any historic floorboards and these shall be retained in situ. Any new floorboards shall exactly match the historic floorboards in terms of size and material. Any new flooring above the historic floorboards shall be of a 'floating floor' construction method that does not damage the historic floorboards.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

All new internal and external finishes relating to the development and the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in connection with the approved works) shall match the existing adjacent work in respect of the materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance including the methods used, material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, unless shown otherwise on the drawings or other documentation hereby approved or required by any condition(s) attached to this consent. The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).

All disturbed surfaces shall be made good using materials to match the existing materials, composition, form, finish and colour of the existing building.Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with Paragraphs 195 to 214 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).
description: Listed Building application for removal of wall, replacement of doors, ceiling tiles and internal alteration
